generif.text: PMID:12095697 pertains to mouse Mrf1 gene which appears to be the homolog of human TSBF1.
These findings indicate that TRIM59 may serve as a multifunctional regulator for innate immune signaling pathways.
TRIM59 interacts with P53, promoting its ubiquitination and degradation, and TRIM59 might promote gastric carcinogenesis via this mechanism.

we knocked down TRIM59 and found that p53 protein expression levels did not upregulate, so we proposed that TRIM59 may promote NSCLC cell growth through other pathways but not the p53 signaling pathway
These data suggest the oncogenic abilities of TRIM59 in osteosarcoma, which promote osteosarcoma cell proliferation, migration and invasion
The expression of TRIM59 was significantly elevated in cervical cancers.
our results suggest that rs1141023 polymorphism contributes to increased predisposition to gastric cancer
TRIM59 overexpression is associated with colorectal cancer metastasis.
Knockdown of TRIM59 may be a promising strategy concerning the early detection and treatment of Renal cell carcinoma.
The level of TRIM59 is correlated with malignant features of colorectal carcinoma (CRC)and may serve as potential therapeutic and preventive strategies for CRC
Silencing TRIM59 suppresses cell proliferation, migration, and orthotopic xenograft brain tumor formation of glioblastoma cells and glioma stem cells.
TRIM59 expression is upregulated in hepatocellular carcinoma (HCC) cells; TRIM59 promotes cell proliferation, migration and invasion in HCC cells

The modified methylation of TRIM59 and KLF14 in top athletes may be accounted for by the biological roles played by these genes. Their known anti-tumour and anti-inflammatory activities suggests that intense physical training has a complex influence on aging and potentially launches signalling networks that contribute to the observed lower risk of elite athletes to develop cardiovascular disease and cancer.

Study demonstrated that TRIM59 was upregulated in breast cancer tissues and associated with poor prognosis. TRIM59 overexpression promotes breast cancer cell proliferation, invasion, migration, cell cycle, and chemoresistance, possibly through regulation of AKT pathway.
Novel dual roles for TRIM59 in autophagy regulation by affecting both the transcription and the ubiquitination of BECN1.
TRIM59 was up-regulated in neuroblastoma.TRIM59 regulates cell proliferation and apoptosis through Wnt/beta-catenin signaling in neuroblastoma.

these data provide evidence that TRIM59 is involved in lung carcinoma growth and progression possibly through the induction of CDK6 expression and epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) process by activation of ERK pathway.
TRIM59 Is a Novel Marker of Poor Prognosis and Promotes Malignant Progression of Ovarian Cancer by Inducing Annexin A2 Expression
Study revealed that TRIM59 is up-regulated in CCA tissues and cell lines and promoted CCA cell proliferation, possibly by affecting the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signalling pathway.
High TRIM59 expression is associated with gefitinib-resistant EGFR mutant lung adenocarcinoma.
Silencing TRIM59 significantly suppressed EOC cell proliferation, migration, and invasion. In terms of molecular mechanism, silencing TRIM59 inhibited the FAK/AKT/MMP pathway.
CDK5-dependent phosphorylation and nuclear translocation of TRIM59 promotes macroH2A1 ubiquitination and tumorigenicity.
TRIM59 predicts poor prognosis and promotes pancreatic cancer progression via the PI3K/AKT/mTOR-glycolysis signaling axis.
TRIM59 promotes tumor growth in hepatocellular carcinoma and regulates the cell cycle by degradation of protein phosphatase 1B.
Expression of TRIM59 in Non-small Cell Lung Cancer and Its Correlation with Prognosis
TRIM59, amplified in ovarian cancer, promotes tumorigenesis through the MKP3/ERK pathway.
miR-4698-Trim59 axis plays a suppressive role in hepatocellular carcinoma.
TRIM59 knockdown reverses high glycolysis rate and cisplatin resistance in A549/DDP cells.
Tripartite motif containing 59 (TRIM59) promotes esophageal cancer progression via promoting MST4 expression and ERK pathway.
TRIM59 inhibits PPM1A through ubiquitination and activates TGF-beta/Smad signaling to promote the invasion of ectopic endometrial stromal cells in endometriosis.
TRIM59 attenuates IL-1beta-driven cartilage matrix degradation in osteoarthritis via direct suppression of NF-kappaB and JAK2/STAT3 signaling pathway.
TRIM59 Promotes Retinoblastoma Progression by Activating the p38-MAPK Signaling Pathway.
Cancer-derived exosomal TRIM59 regulates macrophage NLRP3 inflammasome activation to promote lung cancer progression.
Effects of TRIM59 on RAW264.7 macrophage gene expression and function.
[TRIM59 regulates invasion and migration of nasopharyngeal carcinoma cells by targeted modulation of PPM1B].
TRIM59 promotes osteosarcoma progression via activation of STAT3.
Evaluation of tripartite motif 59 and its diagnostic utility in benign bowel diseases and colorectal cancer.
[Down-regulation of tripartite motif containing 59 (TRIM59) blocks the NF-kappaB signaling pathway and inhibits the invasion and migration of nasopharyngeal carcinoma cells].
The role of Tripartite motif containing 59 (TRIM59) in the proliferation and prognosis of intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma.
Regulations of LINC0196/miR-584-5p/miR-34a-5p/TRIM59 on Progression of Pediatric Neuroblastoma.
TRIM59 guards ER proteostasis and prevents Bortezomib-mediated colorectal cancer (CRC) cells' killing.
TRIM59 promotes steatosis and ferroptosis in non-alcoholic fatty liver disease via enhancing GPX4 ubiquitination.
TRIM59 is suppressed by androgen receptor and acts to promote lineage plasticity and treatment-induced neuroendocrine differentiation in prostate cancer.
SLC35F2-SYVN1-TRIM59 axis critically regulates ferroptosis of pancreatic cancer cells by inhibiting endogenous p53.
A role of TRIM59 in pulmonary hypertension: modulating the protein ubiquitylation modification.
TRIM59 suppresses the brain ischaemia/reperfusion injury and pyroptosis of microglial through mediating the ubiquitination of NLRP3.
Role of TRIM59 in regulating PPM1A in the pathogenesis of silicosis and the intervention effect of tanshinone IIA.

BP.term: negative regulation of canonical NF-kappaB signal transduction
negative regulation of canonical NF-kappaB signal transduction
negative regulation of viral entry into host cell

name: tripartite motif containing 59

pid.name: Validated nuclear estrogen receptor alpha network

summary: Predicted to enable ubiquitin protein ligase activity. Acts upstream of or within negative regulation of I-kappaB kinase/NF-kappaB signaling. Predicted to be located in endoplasmic reticulum. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
